skill.name: error-handling-patterns
skill.description: Master error handling patterns across languages including exceptions, Result types, error propagation, and graceful degradation to build resilient applications. Use when implementing error handling, designing APIs, or improving application reliability.
skill.summary: Master error handling patterns across languages including exceptions, Result types, error propagatio...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected. The skill contains instructional text and code examples only, with no executable scripts or tool calls.

content.user_title: Improve error handling across your codebase
content.value_statement: Weak error handling causes outages and poor diagnostics. This skill gives patterns and examples to design resilient errors and recovery flows.
actual_capabilities: Explain when to use exceptions, Result types, and error codes
Provide Python examples for custom errors and retries
Provide TypeScript examples for Result patterns and async errors
Provide Rust and Go error handling examples
Describe circuit breaker, aggregation, and fallback patterns
limitations: Does not run or modify your codebase
Does not integrate with specific frameworks or logging tools
Does not generate tests or benchmarks

use_cases.title: Harden API error flows
use_cases.description: Design error types and propagation rules for stable service responses.

use_cases.title: Reduce failure cascades
use_cases.description: Apply circuit breaker and fallback patterns for resilient systems.

use_cases.title: Handle async failures
use_cases.description: Structure async errors and user friendly messages for web applications.

prompt_templates.title: Basic error strategy
prompt_templates.scenario: New feature needs safe error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a simple error handling strategy for a new user registration feature. Include when to throw and what to return.

prompt_templates.title: API error design
prompt_templates.scenario: Public API needs stable error format
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an error hierarchy and response format for a public API. Include error codes and messages for validation and not found cases.

prompt_templates.title: Retry guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a retry policy with exponential backoff for calling a payment API. Mention limits and logging guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Resilience patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend circuit breaker and graceful degradation patterns for a multi service checkout flow. Include when to open the circuit.

output_examples.input: Explain how to handle validation errors versus system errors in a Go API.
output: Use sentinel errors for validation and map them to 400 responses
Wrap system errors with context and return 500 responses
Avoid leaking internal details in user messages

best_practices: Validate inputs early and return clear errors
Preserve error context with wrapping and metadata
Catch errors at the layer that can fix them
anti_patterns: Catching broad exceptions and continuing blindly
Returning vague messages like Error occurred

faq.question: Is it compatible with Python, TypeScript, Rust, and Go?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes patterns and examples for all four languages.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only, not code execution or integration.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my logging stack?
faq.answer: No. It offers general advice, not tool specific integration steps.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the provided prompt content.

faq.question: What if the guidance does not fit my framework?
faq.answer: Share your framework details and request an adapted pattern.

faq.question: How does it compare to a style guide?
faq.answer: It focuses on error handling patterns rather than full coding standards.
